creator: carl@ifad.dk
text:
Being able to include parts of the configuration file (esp. loggers)
from other files would make it easier to manage projecs with high
number of loggers.

IMHO it could also make it easier when several developers work on
the same project and each only had to maintain a configuration of
the loggers she uses, rather than the entire set of loggers, thus
potentially interfeering with the configuration desired by the other
developers in the test environment.

I think XInclude is a good candidate for a mechanism allowing that.

/Carl

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
Committed by Elias against log4j/trunk in rev 500767.

I could see no guards on the test that would prevent it from failing when run on a JDK earlier than 1.5 
or when the user-specified parser does not support xinclude (I'm assuming the JDK 1.5+ bundled 
parsers support xinclude).  

The configurator already supports entity reference as a mechanism for modularizing configuration files 
and the bug report and unit tests do not test any functionality that is not already present and 
supported.

I'd be against backporting this to 1.2.
